Compiling The Game:¶

Compiling the game is broken down into subsections to better help understand how you compile the game.

Setting Up The Enviroment:¶

Linux Mint, Ubuntu or Debian:¶

  1. Download and install Android Studio. Please install all tools and extras of the SDK Manager.
  2. Set the environment variable $ANDROID_HOME to point to the Android SDK.
export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/path/to/android/sdk
  1. Set the environment variable $ANDROID_NDK_ROOT to point to the Android NDK.
export ANDROID_NDK_ROOT=$HOME/path/to/android/ndk

For example my enviroment variable paths look like the below code.

export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/Android/Sdk/ && export ANDROID_NDK_ROOT=$HOME/Android/Sdk/ndk-bundle
  1. Get the Godot Game Engine Source Code
git clone https://github.com/godotengine/godot.git

WARNING: The maintainer is has not tested the latest development branch of Godot so it is possible compiling FreecoiL with Godot Latest could fail. TODO: Update what git version and how to git to the correct tested version of Godot.

  1. Install the required dependencies.
sudo apt-get install build-essential scons pkg-config libx11-dev libxcursor-dev libxinerama-dev \
    libgl1-mesa-dev libglu-dev libasound2-dev libpulse-dev libfreetype6-dev libssl-dev libudev-dev \
    libxi-dev libxrandr-dev yasm
  1. Change directory into the engine’s source code.
cd godot
  1. From the FreecoiL repository copy the folder “godot_module/FreecoiL” as in specifically the Folder “FreecoiL inside the folder “godot_module”; and paste it into the Godot repository folder “modules”.
  2. From the FreecoiL repository copy the contents of the “android_java/app/src/main/java/com/feralbytes/games/FreecoiL” folder; which is currently 3 files: BluetoothLeService.java, FreecoiL.java, and GattAttributes.java; paste these files into the Godot repository inside the “modules/FreecoiL/android/src” folder next to the “instructions.md” file.
  3. Ensure that your terminal is still at the Godot repository root which we changed to in step 6.
  4. Run the scons command and gradle as instructed below. The “-j#” argument should have a number equal to the number of processor cores in your computer for optimal speed. The first time the engine is compiled will take a long while. Go enjoy a break.
scons -j4 platform=android target=debug && cd platform/android/java && ./gradlew build && cd - && scons -j4 platform=android target=release && cd platform/android/java && ./gradlew build && cd -
  1. A new folder will have been created in the Godot repository named “bin”. In this folder is a file called “godot.x11.tools.64” make this file executable and run it. It is the Godot engine but now with support for FreecoiL. The files “android_debug.apk” and “android_release.apk” are the export apk’s that godot will use to make FreecoiL apk’s that can run on Android devices again with FreecoiL’s android module baked in.
